moves.3... e5: Of course I want to develop my pieces quickly (even if Nf6 was better than e5 for that reason). In this way I open a diagonal for the Q.
moves.5. Qf3 Nf6 6. Na3: ......I have not a lot of experience with chess, and I want to be helped by someone. Nc3 was so much wrong? That move closes BSB, but that N on a-file doesn't help white so much, so was d3 better than Na3? I can understand white if he wants to castle quickly, even if with the Q on f3 square, it's a mistake cause then: Bg4 and I take the R....I hope you'll help me.
moves.19. Bxf6 Qxf6: And I threaten mate on a8 square if there's no N one2 square.
moves.20. bxc4 Rfe8: I still work for a mate on a8 so I'd like to take the N with the R.
moves.21. Qg3 Rxe2 22. Kxe2 Re8+: The only way to save the K from a # is to sac the Q.
moves.23. Qe3 Rxe3+ 24. Kxe3 Qd4+ 25. Ke2: And now is so much easy!!
moves.25... Qxc4+ 26. Kd1 Qxd5: A developed Q against a not-developed R.....I think I'll win...
moves.27. Re1 Kg7: Kg7 for avoiding checks....white is closer to the defeat.
moves.28. g3 c4 29. c3 b5 30. h4 Qf3+: He loses g3 pawn too, so he decides the best move for him is Resigning. Good 30 moves-game for me. What do you think? Comment, bye!
